</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Proficiency_3">Bonus Proficiency</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Disciple_of_Life">Disciple of Life</span></h3>
<p>Also starting at 1st level, whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Preserve_Life">Channel Divinity: Preserve Life</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, as an action, you present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to five times your cleric level. Choose any creatures within 30 feet of you, and divide those hit points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. You can't use this feature on an undead or a construct.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Blessed_Healer">Blessed Healer</span></h3>
<p>Beginning at 6th level, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature other than you, you regain hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Divine_Strike_4">Divine Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 8th level, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Supreme.C2.A0Healing">Supreme Healing</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 17th level, when you would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell, you instead use the highest number possible for each die. For example, instead of restoring 2d6 hit points to a creature, you restore 12.
</p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Cantrip_2">Bonus Cantrip</span></h3>
<p>When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Light" title="Light">Light</a> cantrip if you don't already know it.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Warding_Flare_2">Warding Flare</span></h3>
<p>Also at 1st level, when you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing light to flare before the attacker before it hits or misses. An attacker that can't be blinded is immune to this feature.
</p><p>You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Radiance_of_the_Dawn">Channel Divinity: Radiance of the Dawn</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, as an action, you present your holy symbol, and any magical darkness within 30 feet of you is dispelled. Additionally, each hostile creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes radiant damage equal to 2d10 + your cleric level on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that has total cover from you is not affected.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Improved_Flare">Improved Flare</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 6th level, you can also use your Warding Flare feature when a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you attacks a creature other than you.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Potent_Spellcasting_5">Potent Spellcasting</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Corona_of_Light">Corona of Light</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 17th level, you can use your action to activate an aura of sunlight that lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it using another action. You emit bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light 30 feet beyond that. Your enemies in the bright light have disadvantage on saving throws against any spell that deals fire or radiant damage.
</p>

<tr>
<td>9th
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Insect_Plague" title="Insect Plague">Insect Plague</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Tree_Stride" title="Tree Stride">Tree Stride</a>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Acolyte_of_Nature">Acolyte of Nature</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you learn one <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Druid_Spells" title="Druid Spells">druid cantrip</a> of your choice. You also gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Nature, or Survival.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Proficiency_4">Bonus Proficiency</span></h3>
<p>Also at 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Charm_Animals_and_Plants">Channel Divinity: Charm Animals and Plants</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, as an action, you present your holy symbol and invoke the name of your deity. Each beast or plant creature that can see you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is charmed by you for 1 minute or until it takes damage. While it is charmed by you, it is friendly to you and other creatures you designate.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Dampen_Elements">Dampen Elements</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 6th level, when you or a creature within 30 feet of you takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can use your reaction to grant resistance to the creature against that instance of the damage.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Divine_Strike_5">Divine Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 8th level, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice) to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Master_of_Nature">Master of Nature</span></h3>
<p>At 17th level, while creatures are charmed by your Charm Animals and Plants feature, you can take a bonus action on your turn to verbally command what each of those creatures will do on its next turn.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Order_Domain"> Order Domain </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Guildmasters' Guide to Ravnica)</sup>
</p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Proficiencies_2">Bonus Proficiencies</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor. You also gain proficiency in the Intimidation or Persuasion skill (your choice)
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Voice_of_Authority">Voice of Authority</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 1st level, if you cast a spell with a spell slot of 1st level or higher and target an ally with the spell, that ally can use their reaction immediately after the spell to make one weapon attack against a creature of your choice that you can see.
</p><p>If the spell targets more than one ally, you choose the ally who can make the attack.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Order.27s_Demand">Channel Divinity: Order's Demand</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to exert an intimidating presence over others.
</p><p>As an action, you present your holy symbol, and each creature of your choice that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you until the end of your next turn or until the charmed creature takes any damage. You can also cause any of the charmed creatures to drop what they are holding when they fail the saving throw.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Embodiment_of_the_Law">Embodiment of the Law</span></h3>
<p>At 6th level, if you cast a spell of the enchantment school using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you can change the spell’s casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting, provided the spell’s casting time is normally 1 action.
</p><p>You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Divine_Strike_6">Divine Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 8th level, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 psychic damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Order.27s_Wrath">Order's Wrath</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 17th level, if you deal your Divine Strike damage to a creature on your turn, you can curse that creature until the start of your next turn. The next time one of your allies hits the cursed creature with an attack, the target also takes 2d8 psychic damage, and the curse ends. You can curse a creature in this way only once per turn.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Protection_Domain"> Protection Domain </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Unearthed Arcana)</sup>
</p>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Proficiency_5">Bonus Proficiency</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Shield_of_the_Faithful">Shield of the Faithful</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 1st level, when a creature attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. To do so, you must be able to see both the attacker and the target.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Radiant_Defense">Channel Divinity: Radiant Defense</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, as an action, you channel blessed energy into an ally that you can see within 30 feet of you. The first time that ally is hit by an attack within the next minute, the attacker takes radiant damage equal to 2d10 + your cleric level.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Blessed_Healer_2">Blessed Healer</span></h3>
<p>Beginning at 6th level, when you cast a spell with a spell slot and it restores hit points to any creature other than you this turn, you regain hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Divine_Strike_7">Divine Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 8th level, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Indomitable_Defense">Indomitable Defense</span></h3>
<p>At 17th level, you gain resistance to two damage types of your choice, choosing from bludgeoning, necrotic, piercing, radiant, and slashing. Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you can change the damage types you chose. As an action, you can temporarily give up this resistance and transfer it to one creature you touch. The creature keeps the resistance until the end of your next short or long rest or until you transfer it back to yourself as a bonus action.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Solidarity_Domain"> Solidarity Domain </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Plane Shift: Amonkhet)</sup>
</p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Proficiency_6">Bonus Proficiency</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Solidarity.27s_Action">Solidarity's Action</span></h3>
<p>Also at 1st level, when you take the Help action to aid an ally's attack, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Preserve_Life_2">Channel Divinity: Preserve Life</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, as an action, you present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to five times your cleric level. Choose any creatures within 30 feet of you, and divide those hit points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. You can't use this feature on an undead or a construct.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Oketra.27s_Blessing">Oketra's Blessing</span></h3>
<p>At 6th level, when a creature within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, you can use your reaction to grant that creature a +10 bonus to the roll, using your Channel Divinity. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Divine_Strike_8">Divine Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 8th level, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Supreme_Healing">Supreme Healing</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 17th level, when you would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell, you instead use the highest number possible for each die. For example, instead of restoring 2d6 hit points to a creature, you restore 12.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Strength_Domain"> Strength Domain </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Plane Shift: Amonkhet)</sup>
</p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Acolyte_of_Strength">Acolyte of Strength</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you learn one <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Druid_Spells" title="Druid Spells">druid cantrip</a> of your choice. You also gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Athletics, Nature, or Survival.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Proficiency_7">Bonus Proficiency</span></h3>
<p>Also at 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Feat_of_Strength">Channel Divinity: Feat of Strength</span></h3>
<p>At 2nd level, when you make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw using Strength, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Rhonas.27s_Blessing">Channel Divinity: Rhonas's Blessing</span></h3>
<p>At 6th level, when a creature within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw using Strength, you can use your reaction to grant that creature a +10 bonus to the roll, using your Channel Divinity. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fail.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Divine_Strike_9">Divine Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 8th level, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Avatar_of_Battle">Avatar of Battle</span></h3>
<p>At 17th level, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tempest_Domain"> Tempest Domain </span></h2>

</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Proficiencies_3">Bonus Proficiencies</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Wrath_of_the_Storm">Wrath of the Storm</span></h3>
<p>Also at 1st level, when a creature within 5 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 2d8 lightning or thunder damage (your choice) on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one.
</p><p>You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Destructive_Wrath">Channel Divinity: Destructive Wrath</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, when you roll lightning or thunder damage, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Thunderbolt_Strike">Thunderbolt Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 6th level, when you deal lightning damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can also push it up to 10 feet away from you.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Divine_Strike_10">Divine Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 8th level, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 thunder damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Stormborn">Stormborn</span></h3>
<p>At 17th level, you have a flying speed equal to your current walking speed whenever you are not underground or indoors.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Trickery_Domain"> Trickery Domain </span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Trickery_Domain_Spells">Trickery Domain Spells</span></h3>

</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Blessing_of_the_Trickster">Blessing of the Trickster</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you can use your action to touch a willing creature other than yourself to give it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Invoke_Duplicity_2">Channel Divinity: Invoke Duplicity</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, as an action, you create a perfect illusion of yourself that lasts for 1 minute, or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). The illusion appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of you. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the illusion up to 30 feet to a space you can see, but it must remain within 120 feet of you.
</p><p>For the duration, you can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space, but you must use your own senses. Additionally, when both you and your illusion are within 5 feet of a creature that can see the illusion, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature, given how distracting the illusion is to the target.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Cloak_of_Shadows_2">Channel Divinity: Cloak of Shadows</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 6th level, as an action, you become invisible until the end of your next turn. You become visible if you attack or cast a spell.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Divine_Strike_11">Divine Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 8th level, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 poison damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Improved_Duplicity_2">Improved Duplicity</span></h3>
<p>At 17th level, you can create up to four duplicates of yourself, instead of one, when you use Invoke Duplicity. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move any number of them up to 30 feet, to a maximum range of 120 feet.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="War_Domain"> War Domain </span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="War_Domain_Spells">War Domain Spells</span></h3>
<table class="article-table">
<tbody><tr>
<th>Cleric Level
</th><th>Spells
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td>1st
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Divine_Favor" title="Divine Favor">Divine Favor</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Shield_of_Faith" title="Shield of Faith">Shield of Faith</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>3rd
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Magic_Weapon" title="Magic Weapon">Magic Weapon</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Spiritual_Weapon" title="Spiritual Weapon">Spiritual Weapon</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>5th
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Crusader%27s_Mantle" title="Crusader's Mantle">Crusader's Mantle</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Spirit_Guardians" title="Spirit Guardians">Spirit Guardians</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>7th
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Freedom_of_Movement" title="Freedom of Movement">Freedom of Movement</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Stoneskin" title="Stoneskin">Stoneskin</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>9th
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Flame_Strike" title="Flame Strike">Flame Strike</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Hold_Monster" title="Hold Monster">Hold Monster</a>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Proficiencies_4">Bonus Proficiencies</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="War_Priest">War Priest</span></h3>
<p>From 1st level, when you use the Attack action, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.
</p><p>You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Guided_Strike">Channel Divinity: Guided Strike</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, when you make an attack roll, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_War_God.27s_Blessing">Channel Divinity: War God's Blessing</span></h3>
<p>At 6th level, when a creature within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, you can use your reaction to grant that creature a +10 bonus to the roll, using your Channel Divinity. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Divine_Strike_12">Divine Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 8th level, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Avatar_of_Battle_2">Avatar of Battle</span></h3>
<p>At 17th level, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Zeal_Domain"> Zeal Domain </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Plane Shift: Amonkhet)</sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Zeal_Domain_Spells">Zeal Domain Spells</span></h3>
<table class="article-table">
<tbody><tr>
<th>Cleric Level
</th><th>Spells
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td>1st
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Searing_Smite" title="Searing Smite">Searing Smite</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Thunderous_Smite" title="Thunderous Smite">Thunderous Smite</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>3rd
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Magic_Weapon" title="Magic Weapon">Magic Weapon</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Shatter" title="Shatter">Shatter</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>5th
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Haste" title="Haste">Haste</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Fireball" title="Fireball">Fireball</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>7th
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Fire_Shield" title="Fire Shield">Fire Shield</a> (warm shield only), <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Freedom_of_Movement" title="Freedom of Movement">Freedom of Movement</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>9th
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Destructive_Wave" title="Destructive Wave">Destructive Wave</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Flame_Strike" title="Flame Strike">Flame Strike</a>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Proficiencies_5">Bonus Proficiencies</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Priest_of_Zeal">Priest of Zeal</span></h3>
<p>From 1st level, when you use the Attack action, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.
</p><p>You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Channel_Divinity:_Consuming_Fervor">Channel Divinity: Consuming Fervor</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, when you roll fire or thunder damage, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage instead of rolling.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Resounding_Strike">Resounding Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 6th level, when you deal thunder damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can also push it up to 10 feet away from you.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Divine_Strike_13">Divine Strike</span></h3>
<p>At 8th level, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Blaze_of_Glory">Blaze of Glory</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 17th level, when you are reduced to 0 hit points by an attacker you can see, even if you would be killed outright, you can use your reaction to move up to your speed toward the attacker and make one melee weapon attack against it, as long as the movement brings it within your reach. You make this attack with advantage. If the attack hits, the creature takes an extra 5d10 fire damage and an extra 5d10 damage of the weapon's type. You then fall unconscious and begin making death saving throws as normal, or you die if the damage you took would have killed you outright.
</p><p>Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
</p>

<script>
	(function () {
		function genUID() {
			return 'xxxxxxxx-xxxx-4xxx-yxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx'.replace(/[xy]/g, function (c) {
				var r = Math.random() * 16 | 0, v = c === 'x' ? r : (r & 0x3 | 0x8);
				return v.toString(16);
			});
		}

		function getCookieValue(cookieName) {
			var cookieSplit = ('; ' + document.cookie).split('; ' + cookieName + '=');

			return cookieSplit.length === 2 ? cookieSplit.pop().split(';').shift() : null;
		}

		var expireDate = new Date(),
			beacon = getCookieValue('wikia_beacon_id'),
			sessionId = getCookieValue('tracking_session_id'),
			pvNumber = getCookieValue('pv_number'),
			pvNumberGlobal = getCookieValue('pv_number_global');

		if (beacon) {
			window.beacon_id = beacon;
		}

		window.sessionId = sessionId ? sessionId : genUID();
		window.pvNumber = pvNumber ? parseInt(pvNumber, 10) + 1 : 1;
		window.pvNumberGlobal = pvNumberGlobal ? parseInt(pvNumberGlobal, 10) + 1 : 1;
		window.pvUID = genUID();

		expireDate = new Date(expireDate.getTime() + 1000 * 60 * 30);
		document.cookie = 'tracking_session_id=' + window.sessionId + '; expires=' + expireDate.toGMTString() +
			';domain=' + window.wgCookieDomain + '; path=' + window.wgCookiePath + ';';
		document.cookie = 'pv_number=' + window.pvNumber + '; expires=' + expireDate.toGMTString() +
			'; path=' + window.wgCookiePath + ';';
		document.cookie = 'pv_number_global=' + window.pvNumberGlobal + '; expires=' + expireDate.toGMTString() +
			';domain=' + window.wgCookieDomain + '; path=' + window.wgCookiePath + ';';
	})();
</script>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Basic_Features"> Basic Features </span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Hit_Points">Hit Points</span></h3>
<ul><li><b>Hit Dice:</b> 1d8 per druid level
</li><li><b>Hit Points at 1st Level:</b> 8 + your Constitution modifier 
</li><li><b>Hit Points at Higher Levels:</b> 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per druid level after 1st 
</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Proficiencies">Proficiencies</span></h3>
<ul><li><b>Armor</b>: Light armor, medium armor, shields (druids will not wear armor or use shields made of metal) 
</li><li><b>Weapons</b>: Clubs, daggers, darts, javelins, maces, quarterstaffs, scimitars, sickles, slings, spears 
</li><li><b>Tools</b>: Herbalism kit 
</li><li><b>Saving</b> <b>Throws</b>: Intelligence, Wisdom 
</li><li><b>Skills</b>: Choose two from Arcana, Animal Handling, Insight, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Religion, and Survival 
</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Equipment">Equipment</span></h3>
<ul><li>(a) a wooden shield or (b) any simple weapon 
</li><li>(a) a scimitar or (b) any simple melee weapon 
</li><li>Leather armor, an explorer's pack, and a druidic focus 
</li></ul>
<p>Alternatively, you can ignore the equipment given by your class and background, and start with 2d4 x 10 gp.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Druidic"> Druidic </span></h2>
<p>You know Druidic, the secret language of druids. You can speak the language and use it to leave hidden messages. You and others who know this language automatically spot such a message. Others spot the message's presence with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check but can't decipher it without magic.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Spellcasting"> Spellcasting </span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Cantrips">Cantrips</span></h3>
<p>At 1st level, you know two cantrips of your choice from the <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Druid_Spells" title="Druid Spells">druid spell list</a>. You learn additional druid cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Druid table.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Preparing_and_Casting_Spells">Preparing and Casting Spells</span></h3>
<p>The Druid table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your druid spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these druid spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
</p><p>You prepare the list of druid spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the druid spell list. When you do so, choose a number of druid spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your druid level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.
</p><p>You can also change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Spellcasting_Ability">Spellcasting Ability</span></h3>
<p>Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your druid spells. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a druid spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
</p><p><b>Spell Save DC</b> = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
</p><p><b>Spell attack modifier</b> = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Ritual_Casting">Ritual Casting</span></h3>
<p>You can cast a druid spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Spellcasting_Focus">Spellcasting Focus</span></h3>
<p>You can use a druidic focus as a spellcasting focus for your druid spells.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Wild_Shape"> Wild Shape </span></h2>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, you can use your action to magically assume the shape of a beast that you have seen before. You can use this feature twice. You regain expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.
</p><p>Your druid level determines the beasts you can transform into, as shown in the Beast Shapes table.
</p>
<table class="article-table">
<tbody><tr>
<th>Level
</th><th>Max CR
</th><th>Limitations
</th><th>Example
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td>2nd
</td><td>1/4
</td><td>No flying or swimming speed
</td><td>Wolf
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>4th
</td><td>1/2
</td><td>No flying speed
</td><td>Crocodile
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>8th
</td><td>1
</td><td>
</td><td>Giant eagle
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>You can stay in a beast shape for a number of hours equal to half your druid level (rounded down). You then revert to your normal form unless you expend another use of this feature. You can revert to your normal form earlier by using a bonus action on your turn. You automatically revert if you fall unconscious, drop to 0 hit points, or die.
</p><p>While you are transformed, the following rules apply:
</p>
<ul><li>Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus is higher than yours, use the creature's bonus. If the creature has any legendary or lair actions, you can't use them.
</li><li>When you transform, you assume the beast's hit points and Hit Dice. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. However, if you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any extra damage carries over to your normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked unconscious.
</li><li>You can't cast spells, and your ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of your beast form. Transforming doesn't break your concentration on a spell you've already cast, however, or prevent you from taking actions that are part of a spell that you've already cast.
</li><li>You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, you can't use any of your special senses, such as darkvision, unless your new form also has that sense.
</li><li>You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space, merges into your new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the GM decides whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment. Your equipment doesn't change to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with the form has no effect until you leave the form.
</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Druid_Circle"> Druid Circle </span></h2>
<p>At 2nd level, you choose to identify with a circle of druids. Your choice grants you features at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.
</p>
<ul><li><a href="#Circle_of_Dreams">Circle of Dreams</a>
</li><li><a href="#Circle_of_the_Land">Circle of the Land</a>
</li><li><a href="#Circle_of_the_Moon">Circle of the Moon</a>
</li><li><a href="#Circle_of_the_Shepherd">Circle of the Shepherd</a>
</li><li><a href="#Circle_of_Spores">Circle of Spores</a>
</li><li><a href="#Circle_of_Twilight">Circle of Twilight</a>
</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Ability_Score_Improvement"> Ability Score Improvement </span></h2>
<p>When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Timeless_Body"> Timeless Body </span></h2>
<p>Starting at 18th level, for every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Beast_Spells"> Beast Spells </span></h2>
<p>Beginning at 18th level, you can cast many of your druid spells in any shape you assume using Wild Shape. You can perform the somatic and verbal components of a druid spell while in a beast shape, but you aren't able to provide material components.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Archdruid"> Archdruid </span></h2>
<p>At 20th level, you can use your Wild Shape an unlimited number of times.
</p><p>Additionally, you can ignore the verbal and somatic components of your druid spells, as well as any material components that lack a cost and aren't consumed by a spell. You gain this benefit in both your normal shape and your beast shape from Wild Shape.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Circle_of_Dreams"> Circle of Dreams </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Xanathar's Guide to Everything)</sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Balm_of_the_Summer_Court">Balm of the Summer Court</span></h3>
<p>At 2nd level, you are a font of energy that offers respite from injuries. You have a pool of fey energy represented by a number of d6s equal to your druid level.
</p><p>As a bonus action, you can choose one creature you can see within 120 feet of you and spend a number of those dice equal to half your druid level or less. Roll the spent dice and add them together. The target regains a number of hit points equal to the total. The target also gains 1 temporary hit point per die spent.
</p><p>You regain the expended dice when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Hearth_of_Moonlight_and_Shadow">Hearth of Moonlight and Shadow</span></h3>
<p>At 6th level, at the start of a rest, you touch a point in space, and an invisible, 30-foot-radius sphere of magic appears, centered on that point. Total cover blocks the sphere.
</p><p>While within the sphere, you and your allies gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) and Wisdom (Perception) checks, and any light from open flames in the sphere (a campfire, torches, or the like) isn't visible outside it.
</p><p>The sphere vanishes at the end of the rest or when you leave the sphere.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Hidden_Paths">Hidden Paths</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 10th level, as a bonus action on your turn, you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Alternatively, you can use your action to teleport one willing creature you touch up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
</p><p>You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Walker_in_Dreams">Walker in Dreams</span></h3>
<p>At 14th level, when you finish a short rest, you can cast one of the following spells, without expending a spell slot or requiring material components: <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Dream" title="Dream">Dream</a> (with you as the messenger), <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Scrying" title="Scrying">Scrying</a>, or <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Teleportation_Circle" title="Teleportation Circle">Teleportation Circle</a>.
</p><p>This use of teleportation circle is special. Rather than opening a portal to a permanent teleportation circle, it opens a portal to the last location where you finished a long rest on your current plane of existence. If you haven't taken a long rest on your current plane, the spell fails but isn't wasted.
</p><p>Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.  
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Circle_of_the_Land"> Circle of the Land </span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bonus_Cantrip">Bonus Cantrip</span></h3>
<p>When you choose this circle at 2nd level, you learn one additional druid cantrip of your choice.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Natural_Recovery">Natural Recovery</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, during a short rest, you choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your druid level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Circle_Spells">Circle Spells</span></h3>
<p>At 3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th level you gain access to circle spells connected to the land where you became a druid. Once you gain access to a circle spell, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn't appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.
</p>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Land.27s_Stride">Land's Stride</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 6th level, moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
</p><p>In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such those created by the entangle spell.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Nature.27s_Ward">Nature's Ward</span></h3>
<p>When you reach 10th level, you can't be charmed or frightened by elementals or fey, and you are immune to poison and disease.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Nature.27s_Sanctuary"> Nature's Sanctuary </span></h3>
<p>When you reach 14th level, when a beast or plant creature attacks you, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your druid spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature must choose a different target, or the attack automatically misses. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours. The creature is aware of this effect before it makes its attack against you.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Circle_of_the_Moon"> Circle of the Moon </span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Combat_Wild_Shape">Combat Wild Shape</span></h3>
<p>When you choose this circle at 2nd level, you gain the ability to use Wild Shape on your turn as a bonus action, rather than as an action.
</p><p>Additionally, while you are transformed by Wild Shape, you can use a bonus action to expend one spell slot to regain 1d8 hit points per level of the spell slot expended.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Circle_Forms">Circle Forms</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Wild Shape to transform into a beast with a challenge rating as high as 1, but must abide by the other limitations there.
</p><p>Starting at 6th level, you can transform into a beast with a challenge rating as high as your druid level divided by 3, rounded down.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Primal_Strike">Primal Strike</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 6th level, your attacks in beast form count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Elemental_Wild_Shape">Elemental Wild Shape</span></h3>
<p>At 10th level, you can expend two uses of Wild Shape at the same time to transform into an air elemental, an earth elemental, a fire elemental, or a water elemental.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Thousand_Forms">Thousand Forms</span></h3>
<p>By 14th level, you can cast the <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Alter_Self" title="Alter Self">Alter Self</a> spell at will.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Circle_of_the_Shepherd"> Circle of the Shepherd </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Xanathar's Guide to Everything)</sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Speech_of_the_Woods">Speech of the Woods</span></h3>
<p>At 2nd level, you learn to speak, read, and write Sylvan. In addition, beasts can understand your speech, and you gain the ability to decipher their noises and motions. Most beasts lack the intelligence to convey or understand sophisticated concepts, but a friendly beast could relay what it has seen or heard in the recent past. This ability doesn't grant you any special friendship with beasts, though you can combine this ability with gifts to curry favor.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Spirit_Totem">Spirit Totem</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, as a bonus action, you can magically summon an incorporeal spirit to a point you can see within 60 feet of you. The spirit creates an aura in a 30-foot radius around that point. It counts as neither a creature nor an object, though it has the spectral appearance of the creature it represents.
</p><p>As a bonus action, you can move the spirit up to 60 feet to a point you can see.
</p><p>The spirit persists for 1 minute or until you're incapacitated. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
</p><p>The effect of the spirit's aura depends on the type of spirit you summon from the options below.
</p>
<ul><li><b>Bear Spirit:</b> Each creature of your choice in the aura when the spirit appears each gain temporary hit points equal to 5 + your druid level. In addition, you and your allies gain advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws while in the aura.
</li><li><b>Hawk Spirit:</b> When a creature makes an attack roll against a target in the spirit's aura, you can use your reaction to grant advantage to that attack roll. In addition, you and your allies have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while in the aura.
</li><li><b>Unicorn Spirit:</b> You and your allies gain advantage on all ability checks made to detect creatures in the spirit's aura. In addition, if you cast a spell with a spell slot that restores hit points to anyone inside or outside the aura, each creature of your choice in the aura also regains hit points equal to your druid level.
</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Mighty_Summoner">Mighty Summoner</span></h3>
<p>At 6th level, any beast or fey summoned or created by your spells gains the following benefits:
</p>
<ul><li>Its hit point maximum increases by 2 per Hit Die.
</li><li>The damage from its natural weapons is considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks and damage.
</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Guardian_Spirit">Guardian Spirit</span></h3>
<p>Beginning at 10th level, when a beast or fey that you summoned or created with a spell ends its turn in your Spirit Totem aura, that creature regains a number of hit points equal to half your druid level.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Faithful_Summons">Faithful Summons</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 14th level, if you are reduced to 0 hit points or are incapacitated against your will, you can immediately gain the benefits of <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Conjure_Animals" title="Conjure Animals">Conjure Animals</a> as if it were cast with a 9th-level spell slot. It summons four beasts of your choice that are challenge rating 2 or lower. The conjured beasts appear within 20 feet of you. If they receive no commands from you, they protect you from harm and attack your foes. The spell lasts for 1 hour, requiring no concentration, or until you dismiss it (no action required).
</p><p>Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Circle_of_Spores"> Circle of Spores </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Guildmasters' Guide to Ravnica)</sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Circle_Spells_2">Circle Spells</span></h3>
<p>At 2nd level, you learn the <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Chill_Touch" title="Chill Touch">Chill Touch</a> cantrip. At 3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th level you gain access to the spells listed for that level in the Circle of Spores Spells table.
</p><p>Once you gain access to one of these spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn't appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.
</p>
<table class="article-table">
<tbody><tr>
<th>Druid Level
</th><th>Circle Spells
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td>3rd
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Blindness/Deafness" title="Blindness/Deafness">Blindness/Deafness</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Gentle_Repose" title="Gentle Repose">Gentle Repose</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>5th
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Animate_Dead" title="Animate Dead">Animate Dead</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Gaseous_Form" title="Gaseous Form">Gaseous Form</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>7th
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Blight" title="Blight">Blight</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Confusion" title="Confusion">Confusion</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>9th
</td><td><a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Cloudkill" title="Cloudkill">Cloudkill</a>, <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Contagion" title="Contagion">Contagion</a>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Halo_of_Spores">Halo of Spores</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, you can launch toxic spores at other creatures. When a creature you can see moves into a space within 10 feet of you or starts its turn there, you can use your reaction to deal 1d4 necrotic damage to that creature unless it succeeds on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. The necrotic damage increases to 1d6 at 6th level, 1d8 at 10th level, and 1d10 at 14th level.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Symbiotic_Entity">Symbiotic Entity</span></h3>
<p>At 2nd level, when you use your Wild Shape feature, you can awaken your spores, rather than transforming. When you do so, you gain 4 temporary hit points per level you have in this class, the damage of your Halo of Spores feature doubles, and your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 poison damage to any target they hit. These benefits last for 10 minutes, until you lose all these temporary hit points, or until you use your Wild Shape again.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Fungal_Infestation">Fungal Infestation</span></h3>
<p>At 6th level, if a beast or a humanoid that is Small or Medium dies within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to animate it, causing it to stand up immediately with 1 hit point. The creature uses the zombie stat block in the Monster Manual. It remains animate for 1 hour, after which time it collapses and dies.
</p><p>In combat, the zombie’s turn comes immediately after yours. It obeys your mental commands, and the only action it can take is the Attack action, making one melee attack.
</p><p>You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Spreading_Spores">Spreading Spores</span></h3>
<p>At 10th level, as a bonus action, you hurl fungal spores up to 30 feet away, where they swirl around in a 10-foot cube for 1 minute. The spores disappear early if you use this feature again, if you dismiss them as a bonus action, or if your Symbiotic Entity feature is no longer active. While the cube of spores persists, you can't use your Halo of Spores feature, but any creature that starts its turn in the cube takes your Halo of Spores damage, unless the creature succeeds on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. A creature can take this damage no more than once per turn.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Fungal_Body">Fungal Body</span></h3>
<p>At 14th level, you can't be blinded, deafened, frightened, or poisoned, and if an attack is a critical hit against you, it doesn't deal its extra damage to you, unless you are incapacitated.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Circle_of_Twilight"> Circle of Twilight </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Unearthed Arcana)</sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Harvest.27s_Scythe">Harvest's Scythe</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 2nd level, you have a pool of energy represented by a number of d10s equal to your druid level.
</p><p>When you roll damage for a spell, you can increase that damage by spending dice from the pool. You can spend a number of dice equal to half your druid level or less. Roll the spent dice and add them to the damage as necrotic damage. If you kill one or more hostile creatures with a spell augmented in this way, you or an ally of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you regains 2 hit points per die spent to increase the spell's damage, or 5 hit points per die if at least one of the slain creatures was undead.
</p><p>You regain the expended dice when you finish a long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Speech_Beyond_the_Grave">Speech Beyond the Grave</span></h3>
<p>At 6th level, you can cast <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Speak_with_Dead" title="Speak with Dead">Speak with Dead</a> without material components, and you understand what the target of this casting says. It can understand your questions, even if you don't share a language or it is not intelligent enough to speak.
</p><p>Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Watcher_at_the_Threshold">Watcher at the Threshold</span></h3>
<p>At 10th level, you gain resistance to necrotic and radiant damage. In addition, while you aren't incapacitated, any ally within 30 feet of you has advantage on death saving throws.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Paths_of_the_Dead">Paths of the Dead</span></h3>
<p>At 14th level, you can cast <a href="/web/20190207025037/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Etherealness" title="Etherealness">Etherealness</a>. Once the spell ends, you can't cast it with this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.
</p>

<!-- Wikia Beacon Tracking -->
<script>
	(function () {
		function genUID() {
			return 'xxxxxxxx-xxxx-4xxx-yxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx'.replace(/[xy]/g, function (c) {
				var r = Math.random() * 16 | 0, v = c === 'x' ? r : (r & 0x3 | 0x8);
				return v.toString(16);
			});
		}

		function getCookieValue(cookieName) {
			var cookieSplit = ('; ' + document.cookie).split('; ' + cookieName + '=');

			return cookieSplit.length === 2 ? cookieSplit.pop().split(';').shift() : null;
		}

		var expireDate = new Date(),
			beacon = getCookieValue('wikia_beacon_id'),
			sessionId = getCookieValue('tracking_session_id'),
			pvNumber = getCookieValue('pv_number'),
			pvNumberGlobal = getCookieValue('pv_number_global');

		if (beacon) {
			window.beacon_id = beacon;
		}

		window.sessionId = sessionId ? sessionId : genUID();
		window.pvNumber = pvNumber ? parseInt(pvNumber, 10) + 1 : 1;
		window.pvNumberGlobal = pvNumberGlobal ? parseInt(pvNumberGlobal, 10) + 1 : 1;
		window.pvUID = genUID();

		expireDate = new Date(expireDate.getTime() + 1000 * 60 * 30);
		document.cookie = 'tracking_session_id=' + window.sessionId + '; expires=' + expireDate.toGMTString() +
			';domain=' + window.wgCookieDomain + '; path=' + window.wgCookiePath + ';';
		document.cookie = 'pv_number=' + window.pvNumber + '; expires=' + expireDate.toGMTString() +
			'; path=' + window.wgCookiePath + ';';
		document.cookie = 'pv_number_global=' + window.pvNumberGlobal + '; expires=' + expireDate.toGMTString() +
			';domain=' + window.wgCookieDomain + '; path=' + window.wgCookiePath + ';';
	})();
</script>

<script>

					'&session_id=' + window.sessionId + '&pv_unique_id=' + window.pvUID + '&pv_number=' + window.pvNumber +

<script type="text/javascript">

	require.optional('ext.wikia.adEngine.adContext'),

], function(trackingOptIn, adContext, adsApi) {
	var url = "//web.archive.org/web/20190207025038/https://s.adadapter.netzathleten-media.de/API-1.0/NA-828433-1/naMediaAd.js";

	function loadNetzAthletenScript() {
		var scriptElementNetzAthleten = document.createElement("script");
		scriptElementNetzAthleten.type = "text/javascript";
		scriptElementNetzAthleten.src = url;

		scriptElementNetzAthleten.addEventListener("load", function() {
			window.naMediaAd.setValue("homesite", window.wgIsMainpage);
		});
		document.head.appendChild(scriptElementNetzAthleten);
	}

	function loadNA(optIn) {
		if (optIn) {
			// user opt-ins for NetzAthleten
			loadNetzAthletenScript();
		}
	}

	if (
		(adContext && adContext.get('opts.netzathleten')) ||
		(adsApi && adsApi.isNetzathletenEnabled())
	) {
		trackingOptIn.pushToUserConsentQueue(loadNA);
	}
});
</script>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Basic_Features"> Basic Features </span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Hit_Points">Hit Points</span></h3>
<ul><li><b>Hit Dice:</b> 1d10 per fighter level.
</li><li><b>Hit Points at 1st Level:</b> 10 + your Constitution modifier.
</li><li><b>Hit Points at Higher Levels:</b> 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per fighter level after 1st.
</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Proficiencies">Proficiencies</span></h3>
<ul><li><b>Armor:</b> All armor, shields
</li><li><b>Weapons:</b> All simple and martial weapons
</li><li><b>Tools:</b> None
</li><li><b>Saving Throws:</b> Strength, Constitution
</li><li><b>Skills:</b> Choose two skills from Acrobatics, Animal Handling, Athletics, History, Insight, Intimidation, Perception, and Survival.
</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Equipment">Equipment</span></h3>
<ul><li>(a) chain mail or (b) leather armor, longbow, and 20 arrows
</li><li>(a) a martial weapon and a shield or (b) two martial weapons
</li><li>(a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) two handaxes
</li><li>(a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack
</li></ul>
<p>Alternatively, you can ignore the equipment from your class and background, and start with 5d4 x 10 gp.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Fighting_Style"> Fighting Style </span></h2>
<p>At first level, choose one of the following options.
</p>
<ul><li><b>Archery:</b> You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
</li><li><b>Defense: </b>While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
</li><li><b>Dueling:</b> When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
</li><li><b>Great Weapon Fighting:</b> When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.
</li><li><b>Protection:</b> When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.
</li><li><b>Two-Weapon Fighting:</b> When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.
</li><li><b>Mariner</b> <b>(Unearthed Arcana):</b> As long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield, you have a swimming speed and a climbing speed equal to your normal speed, and you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
</li><li><b>Close Quarters Shooter (Unearthed Arcana):</b> You are trained in making ranged attack at close quarters. When making a ranged attack while you are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, you do not have disadvantage on the attack roll. Your ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover against targets within 30 feet of you. Finally, you have a +1 bonus to attack rolls on ranged attacks.
</li><li><b>Tunnel Fighter (Unearthed Arcana):</b> You excel at defending narrow passages, doorways, and other tight spaces. As a bonus action, you can enter a defensive stance that lasts until the start of your next turn. While in your defensive stance, you can make opportunity attacks without using your reaction, and you can use your reaction to make a melee attack against a creature that moves more than 5 feet while within your reach.
</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Second_Wind"> Second Wind </span></h2>
<p>At first level, on your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Action_Surge"> Action Surge </span></h2>
<p>Starting at second level, on your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and a possible bonus action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Martial_Archetype"> Martial Archetype </span></h2>
<p>At third level, you choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques. It grants you a feature at 3rd level, and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.
</p>
<ul><li><a href="#Arcane_Archer">Arcane Archer</a>
</li><li><a href="#Battle_Master">Battle Master</a>
</li><li><a href="#Brute">Brute</a>
</li><li><a href="#Cavalier">Cavalier</a>
</li><li><a href="#Champion">Champion</a>
</li><li><a href="#Eldritch_Knight">Eldritch Knight</a>
</li><li><a href="#Monster_Hunter">Monster Hunter</a>
</li><li><a href="#Purple_Dragon_Knight">Purple Dragon Knight</a>
</li><li><a href="#Samurai">Samurai</a>
</li><li><a href="#Scout">Scout</a>
</li><li><a href="#Sharpshooter">Sharpshooter</a>
</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Ability_Score_Improvement"> Ability Score Improvement </span></h2>
<p>When you reach 4th level, and again at 6th, 8th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two Ability Scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Extra_Attack"> Extra Attack </span></h2>
<p>Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 11th level in this class and to four when you reach 20th level in this class.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Indomitable"> Indomitable </span></h2>
<p>Beginning at 9th level, you can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest. You can use this feature twice between long rests starting at 13th level and three times between long rests starting at 17th level.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Arcane_Archer"> Arcane Archer </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Xanathar's Guide To Everything)</sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Arcane_Archer_Lore">Arcane Archer Lore</span></h3>
<p>At 3rd level, you choose to gain proficiency in either the Arcana or the Nature skill, and you choose to learn either the <a href="/web/20190207025038/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Prestidigitation" title="Prestidigitation">Prestidigitation</a> or the <a href="/web/20190207025038/https://dnd5e.fandom.com/wiki/Druidcraft" title="Druidcraft">Druidcraft</a> cantrip. 
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Arcane_Shot">Arcane Shot</span></h3>
<p>At 3rd level, when you gain this feature, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice. Once per turn, when you fire an arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow. You decide to use the option when the arrow hits a creature, unless the option doesn't involve an attack roll. You have two uses of this ability, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest. You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach certain levels in this class: 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level. Each option also improves when you become an 18th-level fighter.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Magic_Arrow">Magic Arrow</span></h3>
<p>At 7th level, whenever you fire a nonmagical arrow from a shortbow or longbow, you can make it magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. The magic fades from the arrow immediately after it hits or misses its target.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Curving_Shot">Curving Shot</span></h3>
<p>At 7th level, when you make an attack roll with a magic arrow and miss, you can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Ever-Ready_Shot">Ever-Ready Shot</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 15th level, if you roll initiative and have no uses of Arcane Shot remaining, you regain one use of it.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Arcane_Shot_Options">Arcane Shot Options</span></h3>
<p>The options are all magical effects. If an option requires a saving throw, your Arcane Shot save DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.
</p>
<ul><li><b>Banishing Arrow:</b> The creature hit by the arrow must also succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, the target's speed is 0, and it is incapacitated. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. After you reach 18th level in this class, a target also takes 2d6 force damage when the arrow hits it.
</li><li><b>Beguiling Arrow:</b> The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra 2d6 psychic damage, and choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it is charmed by the chosen ally until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the chosen ally attacks the charmed target, deals damage to it, or forces it to make a saving throw. The psychic damage increases to 4d6 when you reach 18th level in this class.
</li><li><b>Bursting Arrow:</b> Immediately after the arrow hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take 2d6 force damage each. The force damage increases to 4d6 when you reach 18th level in this class.
</li><li><b>Enfeebling Arrow:</b> The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks is halved until the start of your next turn. The necrotic damage increases to 4d6 when you reach 18th level in this class.
</li><li><b>Grasping Arrow:</b> The creature hit by the arrow is wreathed in brambles and takes an extra 2d6 poison damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes 2d6 slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles with a successful Strength (Athletics) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this option again. The poison damage and slashing damage both increase to 4d6 when you reach 18th level in this class.
</li><li><b>Piercing Arrow:</b> When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the arrow shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra 1d6 piercing damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage. The piercing damage increases to 2d6 when you reach 18th level in this class.
</li><li><b>Seeking Arrow:</b> When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute. The arrow flies toward that creature, moving around corners if necessary and ignoring three-quarters cover and half cover. If the target is within the weapon's range and there is a path large enough for the arrow to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Otherwise, the arrow disappears after traveling as far as it can. On a failed save, the target takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra 1d6 force damage, and you learn the target's current location. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and you don't learn its location. The force damage increases to 2d6 when you reach 18th level in this class.
</li><li><b>Shadow Arrow:</b> The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra 2d6 psychic damage, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of your next turn. The psychic damage increases to 4d6 when you reach 18th level in this class.
</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Battle_Master"> Battle Master </span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Combat_Superiority">Combat Superiority</span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Maneuvers">Maneuvers</span></h4>
<p>You learn three special maneuvers. You can use only one maneuver per attack.
</p><p>You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice at 7th, 10th, and 15th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Superiority_Dice">Superiority Dice</span></h4>
<p>You start with four superiority dice, which are d8s, and you expend one whenever you use a maneuver. You regain them all when you finish a short or long rest. 
</p><p>You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level. 
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Saving_Throws">Saving Throws</span></h4>
<p>Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
</p><p><b>Maneuver save DC:</b> 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice)
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Student_of_War">Student of War</span></h3>
<p>At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tool of your choice.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Know_Your_Enemy">Know Your Enemy</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 7th level, if you spend 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside of combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice:
</p>
<ul><li> Strength score
</li><li> Dexterity score
</li><li> Constitution score
</li><li> Armor Class
</li><li> Current hit points
</li><li> Total class levels (if any)
</li><li> Fighter class levels (if any)
</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Improved_Combat_Superiority">Improved Combat Superiority</span></h3>
<p>When you reach 10th level, your superiority dice turn into d10. When you reach level 18, your dice turn into d12.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Relentless">Relentless</span></h3>
<p>Starting at level 15, whenever you roll for initiative and have zero superiority dice, you get 1 superiority die back.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Maneuvers_2">Maneuvers</span></h3>
<p>The maneuvers are presented in alphabetical order.
</p>
<ul><li><b>Commander's Strike:</b> When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks and use a bonus action to direct one of your companions to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you and expend one superiority die. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.
</li><li><b>Disarming Attack:</b> When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of your choice that it's holding. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the object you choose. The object lands at its feet.  
</li><li><b>Distracting Strike:</b><i> </i>When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to distract the creature, giving your allies an opening. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll. The next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than you has advantage if the attack is made before the start of your next turn.  
</li><li><b>Evasive Footwork:</b> When you move on your turn, you can expend a superiority die, adding the total to your AC until you stop moving.  
</li><li><b>Feinting Attack:</b> You can expend one superiority die and use a bonus action on your turn to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of you as your target. Until the end of the turn, you have advantage on your next attack roll against that creature. If that attack hits, add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.  
</li><li><b>Goading Attack:</b> When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to goad the target into attacking you. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has a disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the end of your next turn.  
</li><li><b>Lunging Attack:</b> When you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die to increase your reach for that attack by 5 feet. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.  
</li><li><b>Maneuvering Attack:</b> When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to maneuver one of your comrades into a more advantageous position. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and you choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature can use its reaction to move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks from the target of your attack.  
</li><li><b>Menacing Attack:</b> When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to frighten the target. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is frightened of you until the end of your next turn.  
</li><li><b>Parry:</b> When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to reduce the damage by the number you roll on your superiority die + your Dexterity modifier.  
</li><li><b>Precision Attack:</b> When you make a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this maneuver before or after making the attack roll, but before any effects of the attack are applied.  
</li><li><b>Pushing Attack:</b> When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to drive the target back. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target up to 15 feet away from you.  
</li><li><b>Rally:</b> On your turn, you can use a bonus action and expend one superiority die to bolster the resolve of one of your companions. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature gains temporary hit points equal to the superiority die roll + your Charisma modifier.  
</li><li><b>Riposte:</b> When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to make a melee attack against the creature. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.  
</li><li><b>Sweeping Attack:</b> When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to damage another creature with the same attack. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to the number you roll on your superiority die. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.  
</li><li><b>Trip Attack:</b> When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.  
</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Brute"> Brute </span></h2>
<p><sup>(Unearthed Arcana)</sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Brute_Force">Brute Force</span></h3>
<p>Starting at 3rd level, whenever you hit with a weapon that you're proficient with and deal damage, the weapon's damage increases by an amount based on your level in this class, as shown on the Brute Bonus Damage table.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Brute_Bonus_Damage">Brute Bonus Damage</span></h4>

</th><th>Damage Increase
